titles: Die Mercurii 9. Maii, 1660. Ordered by the Lords and Commons in Parliament assembled, that the Armes of this common-wealth where ever they are standing, be forthwith taken down, and that the Kings majesties armes be sent up in stead thereof.
author: England and Wales. Parliament.
publisher: Printed by John Macock, and Francis Tyton, Printers to the House of Lords,
notes: Title from caption and opening lines of text.
"The Kings's arms to be set up instead of the Commonwealth's" -- Cf. Steele.
Order to print dated: Die Mercurii 9. Maii, 1660. Signed: Jo. Browne, Cleric. Parliamentorum.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Charles --  II, --  King of England, 1630-1685 --  Early works to 1800.
